@@+# GitHub Copilot Custom Instructions++This document provides information about configuring custom instructions for GitHub Copilot at different levels.++## Overview++GitHub Copilot allows you to customize its behavior through instructions at multiple levels:++- **Personal custom instructions**: Apply to all your repositories+- **Repository custom instructions**: Apply only to a specific repository+- **Organization custom instructions**: Apply to all repositories in an organization+- **Agent custom instructions**: Apply to specific Copilot agents++## Documentation References++For detailed information on configuring custom instructions, refer to the official GitHub documentation:++- [Configure custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/how-tos/configure-custom-instructions/add-repository-instructions)+- [Adding personal custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)+- [Adding repository custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-repository-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)+- [Adding organization custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-organization-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)+- [Adding agent custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-agent-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)++## Repository Custom Instructions++To add custom instructions for this repository, create a file at `.github/copilot-instructions.md` in the repository root.++### Example Structure++```markdown+# Repository-Specific Instructions++## Code Style+- Use descriptive variable names+- Add comments for complex logic+- Follow the project's established patterns++## Testing+- Write unit tests for all new features+- Ensure code coverage remains above 80%++## Documentation+- Update README.md for any new features+- Add inline documentation for public APIs+```++## Personal Custom Instructions++Personal custom instructions apply to all repositories you work on.++### How to Add Personal Instructions++1. Go to your GitHub Copilot settings+2. Navigate to the "Custom Instructions" section+3. Add your personal preferences++### Example Personal Instructions++```markdown+# Personal Coding Preferences++- Prefer functional programming patterns+- Use TypeScript for JavaScript projects+- Write comprehensive error handling+- Include logging for debugging+```++## Organization Custom Instructions++Organization custom instructions apply to all repositories within your organization.++### How to Add Organization Instructions++1. Organization owners can configure instructions in organization settings+2. Navigate to Copilot settings in your organization+3. Add organization-wide coding standards++### Example Organization Instructions++```markdown+# Organization Coding Standards++## Security+- Never hardcode credentials+- Use environment variables for configuration+- Follow OWASP security guidelines++## Code Review+- All code must be reviewed before merging+- Run linters and tests before submitting PRs+```++## Agent Custom Instructions++Agent custom instructions allow you to customize specific Copilot agents for particular tasks.++### How to Add Agent Instructions++Create files in the `.github/agents/` directory with specific instructions for different agent types.++### Example Agent Instructions++```markdown+# Agent-Specific Instructions++## Review Agent+- Focus on security vulnerabilities+- Check for performance issues+- Verify code follows style guide++## Documentation Agent+- Generate comprehensive API documentation+- Include usage examples+- Update changelog for user-facing changes+```++## Best Practices++1. **Be Specific**: Clear, specific instructions yield better results+2. **Prioritize**: List most important guidelines first+3. **Update Regularly**: Keep instructions current with project evolution+4. **Use Examples**: Include code examples when possible+5. **Avoid Conflicts**: Ensure instructions at different levels don't contradict each other++## Instruction Priority++When multiple instruction levels are configured, they are applied in the following order (from highest to lowest priority):++1. Agent custom instructions+2. Repository custom instructions+3. Organization custom instructions+4. Personal custom instructions++## Getting Started++To get started with custom instructions for this repository:++1. Review the documentation links above+2. Determine which instruction levels are appropriate for your use case+3. Create the necessary configuration files+4. Test Copilot's behavior with your instructions+5. Iterate and refine based on results++## Additional Resources++- [GitHub Copilot Documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot)+- [GitHub Copilot Best Practices](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/best-practices-for-using-github-copilot)+- [Prompt Engineering for Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/prompt-engineering-for-github-copilot)

optionsOriginal file line numberDiff line numberDiff line change@@ -0,0 +1,169 @@# GitHub Copilot Custom InstructionsThis document provides information about configuring custom instructions for GitHub Copilot at different levels.## OverviewGitHub Copilot allows you to customize its behavior through instructions at multiple levels:- **Personal custom instructions**: Apply to all your repositories- **Repository custom instructions**: Apply only to a specific repository- **Organization custom instructions**: Apply to all repositories in an organization- **Agent custom instructions**: Apply to specific Copilot agents## Documentation ReferencesFor detailed information on configuring custom instructions, refer to the official GitHub documentation:- [Add repository instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/how-tos/configure-custom-instructions/add-repository-instructions)- [Adding custom instructions for GitHub Copilot (Overview)](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)- [Adding personal custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-personal-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)- [Adding repository custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-repository-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)- [Adding organization custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-organization-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)- [Adding agent custom instructions for GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/customizing-copilot/adding-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot#adding-agent-custom-instructions-for-github-copilot)## Repository Custom InstructionsTo add custom instructions for this repository, create a file at `.github/copilot-instructions.md` in the repository root.### Example Structure```markdown# Repository-Specific Instructions## Code Style- Use descriptive variable names- Add comments for complex logic- Follow the project's established patterns## Testing- Write unit tests for all new features- Ensure code coverage remains above 80%## Documentation- Update README.md for any new features- Add inline documentation for public APIs```## Personal Custom InstructionsPersonal custom instructions apply to all repositories you work on.### How to Add Personal InstructionsPersonal instructions can be configured in your development environment:**In Visual Studio Code:**1. Open VS Code Settings (File > Preferences > Settings or `Cmd/Ctrl + ,`)2. Search for "GitHub Copilot" or "copilot"3. Look for settings related to custom instructions (note: setting names may vary by version)4. Add your personal preferences in the available text fieldAlternatively, you can configure instructions through GitHub.com which syncs across all supported IDEs.**On GitHub.com:**1. Go to your GitHub account settings2. Navigate to "Copilot" in the left sidebar3. Find the "Custom Instructions" section4. Add your personal coding preferencesNote: The exact location may vary based on your IDE and GitHub Copilot version.### Example Personal Instructions```markdown# Personal Coding Preferences- Prefer functional programming patterns- Use TypeScript for JavaScript projects- Write comprehensive error handling- Include logging for debugging```## Organization Custom InstructionsOrganization custom instructions apply to all repositories within your organization.### How to Add Organization Instructions1. Organization owners can configure instructions in organization settings2. Navigate to Copilot settings in your organization3. Add organization-wide coding standards### Example Organization Instructions```markdown# Organization Coding Standards## Security- Never hardcode credentials- Use environment variables for configuration- Follow OWASP security guidelines## Code Review- All code must be reviewed before merging- Run linters and tests before submitting PRs```## Agent Custom InstructionsAgent custom instructions allow you to customize specific Copilot agents for particular tasks. These are typically configured through GitHub's interface or IDE settings.### How to Add Agent InstructionsAgent instructions are configured through your development environment or GitHub settings:1. Access your GitHub Copilot agent settings in your IDE or on GitHub.com2. Select the specific agent you want to customize (e.g., code review, documentation)3. Add custom instructions for that agent's behaviorRefer to the official GitHub documentation for the most current information on configuring agent-specific instructions.### Example Agent Instructions```markdown# Agent-Specific Instructions## Review Agent- Focus on security vulnerabilities- Check for performance issues- Verify code follows style guide## Documentation Agent- Generate comprehensive API documentation- Include usage examples- Update changelog for user-facing changes```## Best Practices1. **Be Specific**: Clear, specific instructions yield better results2. **Prioritize**: List most important guidelines first3. **Update Regularly**: Keep instructions current with project evolution4. **Use Examples**: Include code examples when possible5. **Avoid Conflicts**: Ensure instructions at different levels don't contradict each other## Instruction PriorityWhen multiple instruction levels are configured, they are applied in the following order (from highest to lowest priority):1. Agent custom instructions2. Repository custom instructions3. Organization custom instructions4. Personal custom instructions## Getting StartedTo get started with custom instructions for this repository:1. Review the documentation links above2. Determine which instruction levels are appropriate for your use case3. Create the necessary configuration files4. Test Copilot's behavior with your instructions5. Iterate and refine based on results## Additional Resources- [GitHub Copilot Documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot)- [GitHub Copilot Best Practices](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/best-practices-for-using-github-copilot)- [Prompt Engineering for Copilot](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/prompt-engineering-for-github-copilot)
